alert.note: Alert for McMinn; Meigs; Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 5:51AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, McMinn, Meigs and Rhea. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Athens, Dayton, Decatur, Spring City, Graysville, Niota, Calhoun, Old Washington, Peakland, Evensville, Hillsview, Clear Water, Big Spring, Riceville, Ten Mile, Piney Falls State Park, Murray Store, Grandview, Stinging Fork Falls State Park and Sale Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
